update.description:
This pull request implements the `self_collide` boolean for Model.

If model `self_collide` is true, all links will be considered to collide with each other unless `self_collide` is specified as false in the link.

See new test case added to `integration/physics_collision.cc` and world `model_self_collide.world` for an example.

[Companion SDF pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/149/added-self_collide-element-for-model/diff)
update.title: Implemented self_collide bool for Model

content.raw: In [collide_bitmask.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/37a2ff7f107d2b23ea9d262d93c664399843d634/test/worlds/collide_bitmask.world), each model has only one link, so calling `Model::GetWorldLinearVel` is sufficient. content.raw: Yeah, I stole this from Nate's `collide_bitmask` test so we might want to correct it there too. I guess checking the velocity of the topmost link (`link2`) might work.
content.html: Yeah, I stole this from Nate's collide_bitmask test so we might want to correct it there too. I guess checking the velocity of the topmost link (link2) might work.

content.raw: `Model::GetWorldLinearVel` return the velocity of the first link in the model, so these expectations technically don't check the velocity of all the links. I'll see if it's easy to modify this to check them all...
content.html: Model::GetWorldLinearVel return the velocity of the first link in the model, so these expectations technically don't check the velocity of all the links. I'll see if it's easy to modify this to check them all...

This pull request implements the `self_collide` boolean for Model.

[Companion SDF pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/149/added-self_collide-element-for-model/diff)
update.title: Implemented self_collide bool for Model

content.raw:
After looking at the test world and expectations, I believe the `self_collide` tag works as follows: before checking collision bitmasks, the ODE collision checker will skip the collision check if both of the following are true:

* the links are from the same model
* both of the links have `self_collide == false` (`NOT (self_collide1 OR self_collide2)`)

Otherwise it will check collision bitmasks and do the rest of the routine.

After understanding this, the [sdformat documentation of self_collide](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/default/sdf/1.5/link.sdf#cl-14), seems true but incomplete:
~~~
If true, the link can collide with other links in the model.
~~~

I'd like to clarify the documentation in `link.sdf` and in the API calls for `[GS]etSelfCollide` in Link.hh and Model.hh.
content.html:
After looking at the test world and expectations, I believe the self_collide tag works as follows: before checking collision bitmasks, the ODE collision checker will skip the collision check if both of the following are true:

  • the links are from the same model
  • both of the links have self_collide == false (NOT (self_collide1 OR self_collide2))

Otherwise it will check collision bitmasks and do the rest of the routine.

After understanding this, the sdformat documentation of self_collide, seems true but incomplete:

If true, the link can collide with other links in the model.

I'd like to clarify the documentation in link.sdf and in the API calls for [GS]etSelfCollide in Link.hh and Model.hh.
done in 027049d95171

content.raw:
Can we reorient the `some_collide` links to illustrate which ones are colliding with each other? (this matches the `collide_bitmask.world` orientation)

~~~
diff -r 11726e708b5e test/worlds/model_self_collide.world
--- a/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world	Thu Mar 05 10:24:23 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world	Thu Mar 05 14:07:52 2015 -0800
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@
       </link>
 
       <link name="link1">
-        <pose>0 0 3.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>-1.5 1.5 3.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
         <self_collide>false</self_collide>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@
       </link>
 
       <link name="link2">
-        <pose>0 0 6.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>0 1.5 6.0 0 0 2.24</pose>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
           <inertia>
~~~
content.html:
Can we reorient the some_collide links to illustrate which ones are colliding with each other? (this matches the collide_bitmask.world orientation)

diff -r 11726e708b5e test/worlds/model_self_collide.world
--- a/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world  Thu Mar 05 10:24:23 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world  Thu Mar 05 14:07:52 2015 -0800
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@
       </link>

       <link name="link1">
-        <pose>0 0 3.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>-1.5 1.5 3.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
         <self_collide>false</self_collide>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@
       </link>

       <link name="link2">
-        <pose>0 0 6.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>0 1.5 6.0 0 0 2.24</pose>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
           <inertia>

if (this->sdf->HasElement("self_collide"))
  {
    this->SetSelfCollide(this->sdf->Get<bool>("self_collide"));
  }
  else 
  {
    this->SetSelfCollide(this->GetModel()->GetSelfCollide());
  }

content.raw: Looks good, thanks. Just one thing I noticed, `self_collide` for links isn't read-only but changing it in the GUI doesn't seem to change anything in the server. Should we make it `setEnabled(false);`?
content.html: Looks good, thanks. Just one thing I noticed, self_collide for links isn't read-only but changing it in the GUI doesn't seem to change anything in the server. Should we make it setEnabled(false);?

content.raw:
Checking self-collisions for a model is not implemented in the other physics engines. The self-collide model element can be set in other physics engines (in SDF and in Model.cc). I originally made this a TEST_P and changed it when I realized when all of the engines were failing besides ODE. I can revert it self-collisions in other physics engines will happen in the future.

Which reminds me--if we want to use DART in Haptix, and we want to arm model to collide with itself, then model self-collisions in DART should be enabled... (@hsu, @scpeters)
content.html:
Checking self-collisions for a model is not implemented in the other physics engines. The self-collide model element can be set in other physics engines (in SDF and in Model.cc). I originally made this a TEST_P and changed it when I realized when all of the engines were failing besides ODE. I can revert it self-collisions in other physics engines will happen in the future.

Which reminds me--if we want to use DART in Haptix, and we want to arm model to collide with itself, then model self-collisions in DART should be enabled... (@hsu, @scpeters)

content.raw: Is the plan to support other physics engines in the future or is this an ODE exclusive thing? If it might be extended, it could be good to make this a `TEST_P`?
content.html: Is the plan to support other physics engines in the future or is this an ODE exclusive thing? If it might be extended, it could be good to make this a TEST_P?
